definition: to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over

sentences.english: We believe in the priesthood of all believers, the parity of ministers and the laity.
sentences.chinese: 信徒皆爲祭司，受職者與平信徒同心服事。

sentences.english: When you are really as big as ostrich, chicken's knowing clothes.
sentences.chinese: 當你真像鴕鳥那麼大時，小雞纔會心服。

sentences.english: I succeeded in advising him to give up his idea.
sentences.chinese: 我使心服他放棄了阿誰想法。

sentences.english: Their boss made a fair decision that they could both respect.
sentences.chinese: 老闆做了一個公平決定，他們都心服口服。

sentences.english: Which would make Barcelona's lopsided win even more impressive.
sentences.chinese: 巴塞羅那一邊倒的勝利是令人心服口服的。

sentences.english: Original gowardesh just watch frightened chicken monkey, and thus take orally.
sentences.chinese: 原來狗娃只是“嚇雞儆猴”，衆人由此心服口服。

sentences.english: You can buy a man with gold, but only blood and steel will keep him true.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用錢買通，但只有鐵血才能讓他心服口服。

sentences.english: It is easy to say that they are a better team than we are.
sentences.chinese: 說他們是一隻更好的球隊也是讓人口服心服的。

sentences.english: Each serving 10 pills Kong Xinfu, warm wine to send the next.
sentences.chinese: 每服十丸，空心服，溫酒送下。

sentences.english: I hope you'll try to convince them to step up production.
sentences.chinese: 希望你們能設法使心服他們加速出產。

sentences.english: The problem was the Truth was so convincing how could anyone not be persuaded by it.
sentences.chinese: 問題是真理令人心服口服，誰不能被它說服呢。

sentences.english: Have you accidentally kicked a small child?
Dad is trying to persuade Jim by dangling the carrot of hellogher allowance.
sentences.chinese: 父親以增長零用錢爲餌詭計使心服吉姆。

deference/esteem/to admire

convinced/to admire from the heart/enchanted
to overawe/to be scared into submission

to sneer
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
